title: It's All in the Embedding! Fake News Detection Using Document Embeddings. (arXiv:2304.07781v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: With the current shift in the mass media landscape from journalistic rigor to social media, personalized social media is becoming the new norm. Although the digitalization progress of the media brings many advantages, it also increases the risk of spreading disinformation, misinformation, and malformation through the use of fake news. The emergence of this harmful phenomenon has managed to polarize society and manipulate public opinion on particular topics, e.g., elections, vaccinations, etc. Such information propagated on social media can distort public perceptions and generate social unrest while lacking the rigor of traditional journalism. translated_title: 文本嵌入精准检测假新闻
translated_abstract: 随着媒体的数字化进程和社交媒体的兴起，个性化社交媒体已成为新的常态。然而，数字化进程增加了流传假信息、错误信息和变形信息的风险，从而导致了假新闻这一有害现象的出现。这些信息可以扭曲公众对特定话题的看法，并且缺乏传统新闻的严谨性。为了开发有效的工具来检测假新闻，自然语言处理和机器学习技术至关重要。本文提出了一种基于文本嵌入的假新闻检测方法，利用新闻文章的时间和主题背景。实验结果表明，我们的方法在各种数据集上均取得了较高的准确度，并且超越了基线模型和其他最先进的方法。
tldr: 本文提出一种基于文本嵌入的假新闻检测方法，利用新闻文章的时间和主题背景，可有效检测假新闻。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a method for detecting fake news based on document embeddings that leverages both temporal and topical contexts of news articles. The approach achieves high accuracy across various datasets and outperforms baseline models and other state-of-the-art methods.
